Generation I.Red: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
Generation I.Yellow: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
Generation I.Stadium: Its wings are short, so it can't fly a long distance. If it's not eating, it darts around in a hurry.

Generation II.Gold: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak.
Generation II.Silver: Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed.
Generation II.Crystal: To protect its territory, it flies around ceaselessly, making high-pitched cries.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
Generation III.Sapphire: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
Generation III.Emerald: Its loud cry can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
Generation III.FireRed: It busily flits around here and there. Even if it is frail, it can be a tough foe that uses Mirror Move .
Generation III.LeafGreen: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

Generation IV.Diamond: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation IV.Pearl: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation IV.Platinum: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed.

Generation V.Black: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation V.White: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation V.Black 2: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation V.White 2: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

Generation VI.X: Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed.
Generation VI.Y: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.

Generation VII.Sun: Its short wings make it inept at flying. It moves about hurriedly and pecks at Bug-type Pokémon in the tall grass.
Generation VII.Moon: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect its territory.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Due to its short wings, it can't fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
